page.title: 01Ref. 04520453: General
page.content: This block is situated two or three miles North-West of the city of{York} straddling the A59 road and the BR line from{York}to{Knaresborough.} The terrain in this block is almost completely flat, dominated by the bleak{Scagglethorpe Moor}and drained{ by{The Foss}a tributary stream of the {River Ouse}which also flows across the North-East corner of the block on its way into the centre of York. There are two small hamlets in the South-West corner of the block:{High {Moor}and{Hessay.}The larger village of {Upper Poppleton}is situated on the Eastern boundary of the block which roughly coincides with the border between{Upper}and{Nether Poppleton.}
